description: We're currently pinning to an old version of pep8. We should probably be using the latest, or at the very least, 0.6.
title: Use latest pep8 in pip-requires

comments.content: We're currently pinning to an old version of pep8. We should probably be using the latest, or at the very least, 0.6.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~rconradharris

comments.content:
Yet another reason why putting:

dependency==specific-version

in pip-requires is generally not a good thing.

-jay
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jaypipes

comments.content:
Our Hudson setup being Ubuntu-based and Ubuntu having pep8 0.5.0 in Maverick and Natty, I suspect the automated tests on trunk are using 0.5.0... hence the pinning for those using pip-requires ?

Any reason why we would *want* to use pep8 0.6 ?
